unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals Are Your Next Big Hangout
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals Are Your Next Big Hangout

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever wondered where all the really *good* movies are hiding? I'm not talking about your usual Friday night blockbuster. I'm talking about the films that make you think, make you feel, maybe even make you question your entire existence. The answer? Film festivals, baby!

I am talking about the films that make you think, make you feel, maybe even make you question your entire existence. The answer? Film festivals, baby!

unnormalised: Seriously, these aren't just for fancy-pants directors and critics. Film festivals are a total blast for anyone who loves a good story on the big screen. Think of it as a movie marathon, but with way cooler films and way better snacks (hopefully samosas are involved somewhere).
normalised: Seriously, these are not just for fancy-pants directors and critics. Film festivals are a total blast for anyone who loves a good story on the big screen. Think of it as a movie marathon, but with way cooler films and way better snacks (hopefully samosas are involved somewhere).

unnormalised: India has a bunch of awesome film festivals. The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa is legendary. It runs for like, 9 days! Talk about a binge-watch. But there are tons of smaller, regional ones too. You can find festivals dedicated to documentary films, short films, even animation. Something for everyone, really.

unnormalised: Why should you go? Well, for starters, you get to see films you'd probably never find in your local PVR. You might stumble upon the next *Gully Boy* before everyone else. You’ll also get to meet and chat with filmmakers and actors – maybe even snag an autograph (or a selfie!).

unnormalised: It’s also a great way to discover new cultures and perspectives. You can see films from all over the world, learn about different traditions, and broaden your horizons. All while sitting in a dark room eating popcorn – what’s not to love?
normalised: It is also a great way to discover new cultures and perspectives. You can see films from all over the world, learn about different traditions, and broaden your horizons. All while sitting in a dark room eating popcorn – what is not to love?

unnormalised: Plus, film festivals are often located in cool places. Imagine checking out a film festival in Shimla, surrounded by snow-capped mountains! Or maybe one in Kochi, with its beautiful backwaters. It's a vacation and a movie experience rolled into one.
normalised: Plus, film festivals are often located in cool places. Imagine checking out a film festival in Shimla, surrounded by snow-capped mountains! Or maybe one in Kochi, with its beautiful backwaters. It is a vacation and a movie experience rolled into one.

unnormalised: So next time you're looking for something different to do, skip the same old mall and check out a film festival near you. You might just discover your new favorite film...or at least get some great content for your Instagram feed. Just remember to check the schedule and book your tickets in advance! Some of the smaller festivals have limited seats or are in halls that can only seat 50 people or so. Happy watching!
